Functions

Pass-through methods that help Crystal to integrate with iOS

(void) + CrystalSession::willRotateToInterfaceOrientation:duration:
 Call this from your top-level view controller if your game uses Apple's UIViewController or subclasses.All view rotations are supported by Crystal, though you can limit this in your own app. If the view rotation is to be limited to one rotation (recommended) call the lockToOrientation: method on CrystalSession. If you would like to support more than one rotation call the lockToOrientationList: method.
(void) + CrystalSession::didRotateFromInterfaceOrientation:
 Call this from your top-level view controller if your game uses Apple's UIViewController or subclasses.All view rotations are supported by Crystal, though you can limit this in your own app. If the view rotation is to be limited to one rotation (recommended) call the lockToOrientation: method on CrystalSession. If you would like to support more than one rotation call the lockToOrientationList: method.

didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithError: (NSError *)  error 

Needed for push notifications. Pass-through from UIApplicationDelegate.

Needed for push notifications. Pass-through from UIApplicationDelegate.

Needed for push notifications. Pass-through from UIApplicationDelegate.

Needed for push notifications. Pass-through from UIApplicationDelegate.

+ (BOOL) application: (UIApplication *)  application
handleOpenUrl: (NSURL *)  url 

Needed for push notifications via email. Pass-through from UIApplicationDelegate.

+ (void) didRotateFromInterfaceOrientation: (UIInterfaceOrientation)  fromInterfaceOrientation  

Call this from your top-level view controller if your game uses Apple's UIViewController or subclasses.All view rotations are supported by Crystal, though you can limit this in your own app. If the view rotation is to be limited to one rotation (recommended) call the lockToOrientation: method on CrystalSession. If you would like to support more than one rotation call the lockToOrientationList: method.

+ (void) willRotateToInterfaceOrientation: (UIInterfaceOrientation)  toInterfaceOrientation
duration: (NSTimeInterval)  duration 

Call this from your top-level view controller if your game uses Apple's UIViewController or subclasses.All view rotations are supported by Crystal, though you can limit this in your own app. If the view rotation is to be limited to one rotation (recommended) call the lockToOrientation: method on CrystalSession. If you would like to support more than one rotation call the lockToOrientationList: method.
